item.title: I want parents to know that I share your concerns and anger...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I want parents to know that I share your concerns and anger finding out district plans via the media and not from Denver Public Schools.

I actually read a Chalkbeat Colorado article about it before anyone from the district notified me.

We will fix this broken line of communication.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Looks like we are heading backwards.
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Looks like we are heading backwards.

The City and County of Denver update will be provided virtually at 11:30 a.m. Tuesday.

Hancock to provide Tuesday update on Denver's COVID-19 response

item.title: Denver Public Schools has called a REMOTE LEARNING DAY due to...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Denver Public Schools has called a REMOTE LEARNING DAY due to weather conditions.

What does this mean?

‚ÅÉ ALL students that have access to chrome books will be required to log on for a ‚Äúnormal‚Äù remote day.

...

‚ÅÉ If you do NOT have access to a chrome book your attendance will be excused.

‚ÅÉ ECE is CANCELLED

Our teams are still following the guidance of public health officials in Denver to make proper calls around our response to COVID-19.

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: If it were up to me and me alone ALL schools in Denver would be...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

If it were up to me and me alone ALL schools in Denver would be remote, but our teams have been working with public health officials to make these calls on how and when students should return to school.

I will say I understand the impact this long closure has on children, especially children of color.

Opening schools in a pandemic isn‚Äôt a one size fits all solution, that is why I support a hybrid model and respecting a parents right to decide what‚Äôs best for their child.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: I know that with ugly weather comes with spotty service if you...

I know that with ugly weather comes with spotty service if you don‚Äôt have a internet hotspot and need one please let me know via: Tay_Anderson@dpsk12.org

item.title: Why the ‚ÄúRaven?‚Äù Here is from the administration at South...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Why the ‚ÄúRaven?‚Äù

Here is from the administration at South High:

We believe that the Ravens represent the South community in a number of ways. Ravens are smart, clever birds that are known to be strategic problem solvers. They are empathetic, loyal creatures that form lifelong bonds. And importantly, the raven is an inclusive animal -- it has a long history of being held in high regard both in Native American culture and others throughout the world, and ravens are not associated with any particular gender or race.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: BREAKING: Denver South High School has officially retired their...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

BREAKING:

Denver South High School has officially retired their rebel mascot which for centuries honored the confederacy and have announced their new mascot will be the Ravens!

As we enter a new era of Denver Public Schools let‚Äôs welcome the South High Ravens to #TeamDPS
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: We‚Äôve signed the Know Justice Know Peace Resolution! Thank...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

We‚Äôve signed the Know Justice Know Peace Resolution!

Thank you to Dr. Martin Luther King Early College for your hard work on this!
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: ‚ÄúWhen I think of our DPS Mount Rushmore, I think of each and...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

‚ÄúWhen I think of our DPS Mount Rushmore, I think of each and every one of your faces, because you have changed the landscape of what it means to be a DPS scholar.‚Äù

The historic Know Justice Know Peace Resolution comes after over a year of work led by Denver Public Schools students, teachers and staff at Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Early College

coloradosun.com

Denver school board unanimously backs curriculum redesign to highlight racially diverse narratives

The historic Know Justice Know Peace Resolution comes after over a year of work led by Denver Public Schools students, teachers and staff at Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Early CollegeThe historic Know Justice Know Peace Resolution comes after over a year of work led by Denver Public Schools students, teachers and staff at Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Early College
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: BREAKING: The DPS School Board has passed the Know Justice Know...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

BREAKING:

The DPS School Board has passed the Know Justice Know Peace Resolution!

We have now overhauled our outdated K-12 curriculum in Denver Public Schools and replaces it with ethnic studies.

...

It shouldn‚Äôt have taken us 160 + years for our students to learn their history.

This work was led by Black women from @dmlkjec that came to the Board of Education and pushed us to lead with bold actions.

Echoing the words of Assistant Principal Brian Cochran this is the beginning not the end.

Tomorrow the School Board will sign this resolution at 11:30 AM!

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: For those that say I don‚Äôt do my job on the Denver School...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

For those that say I don‚Äôt do my job on the Denver School Board, allow me to challenge that.

I am 6-0 on resolutions that I‚Äôve sponsored in my FIRST YEAR in office.

That shatters expectations and records set by other Directors in the past, so long story short ... I GET SHIT DONE & still out in these streets for my people.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: To ensure that our School Board maintains our authorizing power...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

To ensure that our School Board maintains our authorizing power and control over when schools can open in our district, I will be voting ‚ÄòYES‚Äô on the resolution for a delayed opening of the DSST Noel HS for the 2022-2023 school year.

I have been been every explicit with both DPS and DSST that they will NOT get a DPS facility to open their school.

I have also stated I want this to be the LAST DSST to open in Denver Public Schools.

...

With this delayed start it will give us the opportunity to open the Warriors for High Quality Schools STEAM Academy and the NEW Montbello High School.

This is chess not checkers!

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Today the DPS School Board will hear the Know Justice Know Peace...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Today the DPS School Board will hear the Know Justice Know Peace Resolution on final passage.

When we PASS this resolution TONIGHT it will alter ALL outdated white-washed curriculum.

I‚Äôm honored to be the sponsor of this, but this was led by powerful Black women from Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Early College.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: *** Social Media Policy *** Guidelines for functioning in an...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

*** Social Media Policy ***

Guidelines for functioning in an electronic world are the same as the values, ethics and respectability policies expected to live every day. You can expect discussions on many topics and many viewpoints in my posts. You can also expect the following:

*Engagement in healthy, open and honest dialogues

...

*Welcoming of constructive criticism

*Corrections of inaccurate or misleading postings

*Deletion of posts that are spam, inappropriate, defamatory, use profanity, and/or otherwise offensive

*An understanding that respect goes both ways ‚Äî I will use good judgment in my posts and respond to you in a respectful manner. In return, I ask the same of you. (If instances of bullying and/or harassment take place, I may unfriend, block and or report the matter to Facebook, depending on the seriousness of the situation.)

*Honoring of our differences ‚Äî I will not tolerate discrimination (including age, sex, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability, or marital status or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local laws, regulations or ordinances).

For further questions on this policy please email me at Tay_Anderson@dpsk12.org

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson
